alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 6:03PM PST until January 08 at 11:43PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. .Heavy rain has ended and the river has crested. With drier conditions expected, the river will continue to recede and will fall below flood stage later tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 211.5 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County will flood a few roads and low pasture lands near Bucoda. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM PST Saturday the stage was 211.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM PST Saturday was 214.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 206.1 feet Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 211.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1145 PM PST.
